refnamediv.refname: RFC CDK #22: On hydrogen bonds and other non-covalent interactions

refsect1.title: Proposal
refsect1.para: To create an Association class that extends ElectronContainer, that represents an interaction between two molecular entities, e.g. Atom's.
Subclasses of this new Association class can be classes, like HydrogenBond, and IonicInteraction.

refsect1.title: Reason
refsect1.para: The need to store supramolecular interactions. The current Bond element is aimed at covalent bonding, or at least taken as such by the PathTools class in cdk.graph.

The name seems appropriate; the IUPAC Commendium defines it as [1]: The assembling of separate molecular entities into any aggregate, especially of oppositely charged free ions into ion pairs .... About hydrogen bonds it says [2]: A form of association between an electronegative atom and a hydrogen atom attached to a second, relatively electronagative atom.
